transcript.title: COUNCIL FOR THE ORDER OF AUSTRALIA
transcript.content:
Following consultations with the Governor-General, the Honourable

Sir William Deane AC KBE, I am pleased to announce the reappointment

of seven Councillors to the Council for the Order of Australia.

The Council meets twice a year to consider nominations and to make

recommendations for awards in the Order of Australia to the Governor-General.

Rear Admiral Peter Sinclair AC (rtd) will continue as chairman of

the Council which next meets on 5 and 6 August 1998.

The reappointed Councillors are:

* Rear Admiral Peter Sinclair AC

Former Governor of NSW

* The Hon Sir James Killen KCMG

Barrister and former Federal Minister

* Mr Allan Border AO

Former Australian Cricket Captain

* Ms Anne Fulwood

News Presenter

* Ms Sara Henderson

Grazier/Author

* Dr George Santoro AM

Former President Australian Medical

Association (Victoria Branch)

* Mrs Marjorie Turbayne OAM

President Australian Capital Territory

Australia Day Council

I am also pleased to announce the appointment of a new Council member,

Dr Margaret Valadian AO MBE, Director, Aboriginal Education Centre,

Wollongong University.

Dr Valadian replaces Dr Lois O'Donoghue CBE AM. Dr O'Donoghue

served on the Council for many years and I would like to acknowledge

on behalf of the Government and myself, appreciation for the singular

contribution she made to the work of the Council.

All appointments are for two years.

I am delighted that these distinguished Australians have agreed to

continue and give freely of their time to this important national

committee. They bring to the Council for the Order of Australia a

breadth of experience and achievement which encompasses the whole

community and which all Australians can respect and admire.
